text: IsaacAlso written Itzhak or Yitzhak ( Standard Tiberian ; , ) is a figure in Abrahamic religions, one of the three Patriarchs. He is described in the Bible, in the Book of Genesis (chapters 18-27). He was the son of Abraham and Sarah. God tells them they will have a child but they think they are too old and they laugh. They name the boy Isaac after their laughter. Isaac marries Rebecca, and is the father of Esau and Jacob. == Notes == == Other websites == * Isaac in Catholic Encyclopedia * Isaac in Jewish Encyclopedia Category:Old Testament people Category:Ancient Israeli people
title: Isaac
